• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency interim evaluation completed 12/21/2023 identified five areas of
noncompliance, all associated with the conducting and completing of special
evaluations of foster homes. The areas identified were Rule 327 (1)(d), (5)(c),
(6)(b)(c) and (7). Three special evaluations were reviewed as a part of this
renewal inspection and none of these areas were identified as areas of repeat
noncompliance. The CAP for the noncompliance associated with the interim
evaluation of 12/21/2023 was approved 2/8/2024 by DCWL.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the agency's Corrective
Action Plan for the interim evaluation completed 12/21/2023. A primary challenge
for the agency is to maintain adequate staffing levels by the recruitment and
retention of quality personnel.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern. Staff were very pleased with the new
location/facility that the agency moved into recently.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and adoption services. All files were stored
securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI. The building the agency
previously occupied was recently sold and it required the agency to find a new
location/facility. The new facility is a significant improvement in the amount of
space available to meet the current staff needs and accommodate future program
development.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: One relative home needed a smoke detector in the basement area
of the home.
Resolution #1: A smoke detector was provided and installed. A worker visit and
picture documentation confirmation was provided. CAP was submitted 6/26/2024
and approved by DCWL 6/27/2024.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
